data.title: HUNDREDS of Code Enforcement violations.
data.text: Do not stay here!    Mold & bed bugs.  They are a complete rip-off, taking advantage of people who lack a credit card to rent a nicer place.  The police are there constantly.  Sad but true.  If you have the brains to check this review, you will know to NOT stay here.   Awful place.   A blight on the downtown community.   Head to the Hilltop Drive area.

data.title: DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!
data.text: DO NOT STAY HERE. They have bad bed bugs and do nothing about it. they left my sick mom who has cancer and myself without air conditioning for a month in hot weather causing my mom to have to stay in the hospital. Plus theyres nothing but tweakers and peophiles there. DO NOT STAY HERE EVEN THOUGH ITS CHEAP!!! They promise you services and then you dont get them. they give you stained towels and blood stained sheet. they have roaches. and they are very rude people. they advertise a pool but its filled in with rocks. Not safe for children and families. Complete rip off.

data.title: Mold and bug infested
data.text: This motel is a joke! You don't get any real sleep, you have people constantly fighting, police department out there several times daily, people constantly trying to get into your room at night so you really don't feel safe unless you have a weapon with you, the staff consists of 2 child molesters who are high risk predators and a lazy maid, maid service is something you don't get, the rooms are filthy when you rent it, the monthly rent is hell on the budget, the place is full of mold so if you're allergic and  you don't like bugs, don't rent here. Plus the manager/owner and his wife are rude and they have a habit of withholding mail from residents. If you have to choose between here or your vehicle or the mission, for those who have a vehicle, stay there, for those who don't have a vehicle, camp out. You're better off.

data.title: Ameri-Caca Lodged
data.text: The name says Americana but I now loveningly refer to it as Ameri-Caca! The woman in the office is rude and dismissive. When I asked for the internet password she said she did not know and it was not functioning and wouldn't know when it would be back on. The walls are stained and the bathroom looks like the one from the movie "Saw." The carpet is filthy and I saw a roach crawling. When inspecting the mattress I saw so many blood stains it was like the last woman who slept on it must have been on her period while being stabbed. I was concerned about leaving my stuff in the room and even being alone. I might have checked out and gone somewhere else if I wasn't with a guy friend. You gotta not give a s@!% if stay here more than once.

data.title: Good budget option
data.text:
Good value for money- budget option but rooms were clean, well equipped and all you need for an overnight stay. It's not in the best part of town but all the budget motels are here and we had no problems whatsoever. People live here, in a separate block and they were no problem. I don't think ive stayed in a budget motel without long term guests- seems standard, no different here.

Service provided by owners was exceptional- we had some problems returning our rental car and the owner followed us down there, picked us up, showed us where to get the bus later and let us check out late. They also stored our stuff safetly for the day.

Good option if you are passing through and on a budget.

data.title: Stay in your car instead!
data.text: This is absolutely the WORST place I've ever been in. My belongings were pilfered through and items stolen - even tooth brushes and mouthwash! There were drug deals going down in the parking lot. The management (owner?) was rude and refused to talke to me.  You DO NOT want to stay here!

data.title: The WORST Place I have EVER Stayed at!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
data.text:
OMG. This place is the worst place I have ever stayed at.  The bed pillows were flat & Black. It looks like they grabbed them from the dumpster.  The walls were dirty, paint chips, bad patch work, holes in walls. Tile in shower missing. A hold above the shower as if someone is looking at someone taking a shower. TV did not have a plug to plug it into so we had to carry the old box TV to the old refrigerator that was broken inside and set it on top to plug it in the only other plug in the room.  The smoke detector did not have a battery in it.  The blankets had holes in it.  When I removed the bottom sheet there was a bent straw under my sheet.   There was hair on the pillow and sheet so that means they did not replace the sheets.  They have a "No Refund" policy so you can not ask for your money back.  My friend & I did not leave our stuff in the room, not only because of how nasty the room was nut because of the hooker and creepy people outside.

I would never had rented the room but since we did not have enough money to leave to go to another hotel.  I would have slept in my car but was to scared to becuase of the people in the parking lot.

oh, the pool was green and had a lot of garbage floating in it.

after this I am turning the hotel into the health department and the fire department.

data.title: Good Value For Money
data.text:
I stayed with some colleagues. We went to the place because it was cheap. But the hotel was much better than what we expected for the cost. Rooms were clean, its location was good for us and service was prompt and courteous.
Good restaurants nearby and bed was good for a nice sleep after day of hard work.

data.title: Fair for the money, but not in summer
data.text: In Mid-April 2009, I had a modest room as a single, arriving at 8 pm. The manager (owner?) gave me a room with a king-size bed, and the room was acceptable. The furniture was fairly recent and had plenty of drawer space, a writing desk (which would work for laptop with the free wifi), two nightstands with small drawers, plenty of lamps and lighting, and a small chair with ottoman (but without a back cushion on the chair). There was a small fridge, one sink with a large counter, a small microwave, toilet and bath/shower.  This was a non smoking room and it was acceptably clean and fresh. One drawback was the A/C unit.  Set on cooling, fan to any setting (high, low, or auto), it would not run for more than a minute before it took a break.  It would stay off for 2 minutes, then cycle back on.  It was hard to get the room to cool down.  It was 67 degrees outside and 77 degrees inside.  I would not want to chance it in summer.  The manager tried to tell me that was the best the A/C unit would do, and it appeared it was doing what it could.  It was a newer unit, but I was not pleased when he started asking me, "Don't you know how to work an A/C unit?"  I actually opened the cover, found the service instructions, and went through the diagnostics to see if the motel had set a 70 degree minimum cooling or something.  It appeared to check out, and I just slept on top of the covers.  Another tale from the road!

data.title: Only stay here as a last resort (and even then, don't)....
data.text:
I stayed at this dive on a whim, exhausted from driving all day, and the motel 6 nearby was full.   Wish I'd paid more to stay someplace else, this was, hands down, the worst place I've ever stayed (cept maybe this flophouse in Chicago when I was younger).  The rooms obviously hadn't been decorated/renovated since the 70's, as the stiff, shiny paisly bedspread indicated.  Everything was grimy, and the room reeked of pesticide, smoke & B.O.  The carpet was threadbare and horribly stained, looked decades old.  The sound of the traffic from the highway sounded like it was going through my room, it actually woke me up a few times, and I'm a deep sleeper.  

Listen, I'm not a big spender, of modest means, and have stayed in plenty of el cheap-o motels, but this is the first time I've ever felt the need to take my sleeping bag into the room with me, and sleep on top of the bed inside of the sleeping bag, I was that creeped out by the place, I didn't want to touch anything in there.  And it was only $10 cheaper than the motel 6, it was $50, but was a $20 motel at best, a ripoff at that even.  Should have slept in my car...... avoid, avoid, avoid.......

data.title: Horrible
data.text: The Americana hotel was horrible, There was nothing plugged in to the wall you had to move furniture around to plug things in the room was like a sauna when you walked in and the smoke detector went off all night long they never answer there phone and when they do they say Hello you dont even know if you called a hotel or not. At 11am exactly they were knocking on the door asking us to leave and when we were loading our luggage they were walking up to the door asking us for our keys. We did not even properly check out, before they were rushing us off we told them about the smoke detector and they did not even say sorry they pretended like they did not here us. My advise is to stay away from this hotel and dont let the word americana full you they are far from american.

data.title: Scariest Night of my Life
data.text: Please, Please, Please do NOT bring your family to this hotel. It was absolutely awful. If we had not already paid AND arrived very late in the evening, we would have high-tailed it out of there. Drug deals in the parking lot, half-clothed people walking the sidewalks between rooms, bugs in the room, AWFUL! We got dinner at Taco Bell across the street and literally locked ourselves in our room. There are many, many people living at this hotel--NOT a good sign.

data.title: Cheapest place in town
data.text: I stayed here simply because it was the cheapest place in town.  That being said, I had low expectations and I was not disappointed.  The Americana Lodge is definitely a firm 1 star hotel.  The room was fairly clean with a few dead flies on the window sill.  The table, dresser and counter was clean.  The ceiling vent near the sink needed to be cleaned.  There were 2 light bulbs missing, one in a table lamp and one over the sink.  The TV worked fine and had a large selection of stations.  The shower floor was clean but worn.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  I received fresh towels daily and a made bed. The air conditioner worked fine.  Because of it's location near two fairly busy streets, I could hear cars in the middle of the night some nights. The pool was clean.  Because of the low price of this hotel (I paid only $33 a night for 4 nights with a coupon) there are some people who live at this hotel (which I found out from someone at the pool).  There's a Taco Bell across the street and a Winchell's on the corner.  If you are very short on funds, you might find this place to be good enough for one night but most people I know would probably not stay here.

data.title: Minimalstandart aber sauber
data.text: Hotel an zwei grossen Strassen. Sauberkeit war gut, doch es sieht etwas abgekämpft aus. In der Nähe hat es gleich zwei gute Kaffeeshops. Ansonsten in der Gegend auch nichts los. In etwas mehr als einer Meile kann man die weisse Brücke besichtigen, das Wahrzeichen der Stadt.
